Message.Title: My sources tell me....
Message.Msg: that Yahoo is about to explode. Not in a good way. Three big name traders are planning to take a large short position in Yahoo. My sources which are incredibly accurate tell me that Yahoo is missing its revenue targets and that profit will be less than estimated. Also Softbank has rejected Yahoo's request that it buy back Yahoo's shares in YahooJapan while at the same time opposing a public offering of Yahoo's shares on the market. Plus Yahoo has more lawsuits that it hasn't disclosed and will pay all of the money the Mexico says it has to pay, plus more in penalties.My sources are very clear that traders want to see Yahoo drop to the $13 range so that Yahoo can merge with Nokia and RIMM to create a new powerhouse company similar to Alcatel Lucent. That is how Yahoo's cash will be used to revive those two handset manufacturers and give Yahoo a mobile strategy. Yahoo is very determined to own manufacturing assets my sources tell me.

Message.Title: Too many people think they are entitled to something in America
Message.Msg: The Salvation Army, probably the most honest of all charities, can't keep up with the growing number of the needy. I thought unemployment is dropping and economy is getting better??? The needy already get free food from government EBT cards and free obamaphones. Find a job folks!!. Call Obama and ask him why his stimulus didn't fix this problem. Instead of giving your money to Red Cross who will spend on themselves anyway, invite a bum to join me for lunch. We talk about his situation and suggest ways he can support himself. I once lived in a foreign country where the people didnt get all the freebies like in USA and people found ways to support themselves in legal creative ways. Or they starved and died. Too many mooches in our society who far outnumber those who really cant work.

Message.Title: News of Alibaba IPO will spike YHOO to $25 . . . one of the biggest IPOs of all time
Message.Msg: and backed by real ecommerce revenue vs. ad dollars. massive institutional buying supporting the stock and a $3 BIllion buyback waiting in the wings to offer support at any time . . .apparently only a small portion of buyback has actually made purchases on the open market imaging when they start block buying in a big way. Yahoo will want to complete as much of the $3 Billion buyback before 2013 and before news of the alibaba ipo - you'll see them run it to the low $20s within days. Yahoo's stock is working - bullish technicals all over - holding $19 nicely with significant consolidation and accumulation above $19. way above 50 and 200 day ma. nice short position to balance the buybacks - they'll continue to cover. . . .all imho

Topic.Title: Any news on the topic of Yahoo?

Message.Msg: 89, I don't think SB has ever had any intention of buying YHOO's apx 35% of YHOO JAPAN. I think their plan always has been to wait until YJ could do the deal with easy, then have YJ buy back YHOO's 35%. Think of it like this..for a thousand shares of YJ..YHOO owns 350 take those shares off the books, now SB which orginally also owned 350 of ever 1000 shares, would then own 350 out of every 650, instantly over 50% control and not a penny spent. Expect YJ to do the share buy back and maybe even at a slight premium since your talking control of the company. As a side not, a lot of people on this board do not realize that SB was the orginal deep pocket investor for YAHOO (USA)
